perturbation.original_text: 3.6 Todos shall comply with all relevant standards of quality assurance and shall ensure that the Products conform to all Israeli standards and certifications.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.6 Todos shall endeavor to comply with relevant standards of quality assurance and shall make reasonable efforts to ensure that the Products generally conform to Israeli standards and certifications.
perturbation.explanation: The change from 'shall comply' to 'shall endeavor to comply' and 'shall ensure' to 'make reasonable efforts to ensure' weakens the obligation. It introduces ambiguity and allows for discretion in compliance, potentially violating mandatory Israeli regulations for medical device quality assurance and certification.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Israeli Standards Law, specifically related to medical device manufacturing and quality control

perturbation.original_text: 4.9 The Reseller shall comply at all times with all applicable laws, rules, regulations, and industry standards relating to the storage, packaging, marketing, distribution, laboratory work, and sale of the Products in the Territory.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.9 The Reseller shall attempt to comply with the applicable laws, rules, regulations, and industry standards relating to the storage, packaging, marketing, distribution, laboratory work, and sale of the Products in the Territory.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'shall comply at all times' with 'shall attempt to comply' creates ambiguity regarding the level of commitment to legal and regulatory compliance. This introduces uncertainty, as strict compliance may be mandatory under Israeli law for medical devices and healthcare-related activities, potentially leading to non-compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Israeli Public Health Regulations (Medical Devices) and related regulations governing the distribution and sale of medical products.

perturbation.original_text: 4.11 The Reseller shall provide Todos with feedback for a least one percent (1%) of the consumed tests, including providing the actual screening result (by a yearly base) of each test.
perturbation.changed_text: 4.11 The Reseller shall, to the extent feasible, provide Todos with feedback for approximately one percent (1%) of the consumed tests, including providing screening results as available on a yearly base.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'shall provide' to 'shall, to the extent feasible, provide' and 'at least one percent (1%)' to 'approximately one percent (1%)', the obligation to provide feedback becomes vague and discretionary. The term 'as available' makes providing screening results uncertain. This contradicts the implied obligation of data collection for quality control and post-market surveillance, potentially hindering compliance with regulatory requirements concerning product performance monitoring.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Israeli Medical Devices Ordinance regarding post-market surveillance and quality control reporting.
